com.google.code.siren4j.component
Interface Field

All Known Implementing Classes:
FieldImpl
public interface Field

Fields represent controls inside of actions.

Method Summary
 int getMax()
          Specifies the maximum value for the following field types: number, range, date, datetime, datetime-local, month, time and week.
 int getMaxLength()
          The maxlength attribute limits the number of characters that text field can accept.
 int getMin()
          Specifies the minimum value for the following field types: number, range, date, datetime, datetime-local, month, time and week.
 String getName()
          A name describing the control.
 String getPattern()
          The pattern specifies a regular expression which needs to match the fields value in order for validation to be considered as passed.
 String getPlaceholder()
          The placeholder attribute specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field (e.g.
 Integer getStep()
          The step attribute specifies the legal number intervals for an element.
 FieldType getType()
          The field type.
 String getValue()
          A value assigned to the field.
 boolean isRequired()
          Indicates if the field is required upon action submission.
 

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
A name describing the control. (Required).

Returns:
never null or empty.

getType

FieldType getType()
The field type. This may include any of the input types specified in HTML5. default value is FieldType.TEXT. see FieldType for other allowed values (Optional).

Returns:
never null.

getValue

String getValue()
A value assigned to the field. (Optional).

Returns:
may be null or empty.

getPattern

String getPattern()
The pattern specifies a regular expression which needs to match the fields value in order for validation to be considered as passed.

Returns:
may be null or empty.

isRequired

boolean isRequired()
Indicates if the field is required upon action submission.

Returns:
true if required.

getMin

int getMin()
Specifies the minimum value for the following field types: number, range, date, datetime, datetime-local, month, time and week.

Returns:
-1 is considered as a not set state.

getMax

int getMax()
Specifies the maximum value for the following field types: number, range, date, datetime, datetime-local, month, time and week.

Returns:
-1 is considered as a not set state.

getMaxLength

int getMaxLength()
The maxlength attribute limits the number of characters that text field can accept.

Returns:
-1 is considered as a not set state and means no limit on length.

getStep

Integer getStep()
The step attribute specifies the legal number intervals for an element. Example: if step="3", legal numbers could be -3, 0, 3, 6, etc. Used for the following field types: number, range, date, datetime, datetime-local, month, time and week.

Returns:
may be null if not set.

getPlaceholder

String getPlaceholder()
The placeholder attribute specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field (e.g. a sample value or a short description of the expected format). The hint is displayed in the input field when it is empty, and disappears when the field gets focus. Used for the following field types: text, search, url, tel, email, and password

Returns:
may be null or empty.
